description: The Tesla founder criticised two Hampshire trusts' ad for an equality, diversity and inclusion role.
title: NHS trusts defend diversity job after Elon Musk criticism
title_page: NHS trusts defend diversity job after Elon Musk criticism - BBC News
maintext:
Two NHS trusts have responded after Elon Musk criticised their job advert for an equality, diversity and inclusion (EDI) position.
Musk reacted to a video showing diversity related roles advertised on the government website on his social media platform X last week.
The South African born billionaire said the positions were a result of the "woke mind virus".
Isle of Wight and Portsmouth Hospitals University NHS Trusts, whose adverts featured in the video, said they "strive to ensure everyone has equal access to career opportunities and care".
The two trusts, which work in partnership and are led by the same executives, had been advertising for an EDI project manager.
The manager "plays a crucial role to ensure our services and employment are equitable for all and meet the diverse needs of our local communities", they said in a statement to the BBC.
